issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Ability to limit running map and reduce tasks

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: The concurrent task limit feature should only adjust the ANY portion of the AM heartbeat ask when a limit is truly necessary, otherwise extraneous containers could be allocated by the RM to the AM adding some overhead to both.  Specifying a concurrent task limit that is beyond the total number of tasks in the job should be the same as asking for no limit.
fields.summary: Concurrent task limits should only be applied when necessary

comments.body: Attaching patch. Ideally it wouldn't call getTotalMaps/Reduces() on each heartbeat but it keeps the patch small and it looks to be a pretty cheap call.

@aajisaka Thanks for taking a look. I don't believe there was a specific reason for the 3 invocations. I think it was just to make sure a few heartbeats were simulated.
Thank you, Nathan. It makes sense. I'm +1 for the patch.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #11938 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/11938/])
